subject: Business
title: Marketplace Business Models
description: A micro-lesson that makes Marketplace Business Models usable.

hook.text: Uber owns no cars. Airbnb owns no apartments. Yet they're worth more than traditional rivals.

buildup.text: A marketplace connects supply and demand and takes a cut of each transaction.

discovery.text: The chicken-and-egg problem is the hardest: buyers need sellers and sellers need buyers.

twist.text: Most marketplaces subsidize one side first. Uber gave free rides to build the rider base.

climax.text: Once both sides are locked in, switching costs keep them there. That's the real moat.

punchline.text: Own the connection, not the inventory.

quiz.question: What is the biggest challenge for a new marketplace?
options: The chicken-and-egg problem of attracting both sides
